head: nanomcmc / polytensor
CUDA Computational Physics
Purdue University
body: Identified a need for and developed GPU-accelerated computational PyTorch packages published on PyPi packages, nanomcmc and polytensor with documentation in sphinx.
Packages support several collaborative team projects involving Markov Chain Monte Carlo and polynomial computations leading to a 6000% speed-up over CPU-based algorithms.

head: nanomcmc / polytensor
CUDA Computational Physics
Purdue University
body: Identified a need for and led development of GPU-accelerated computational PyTorch nanomcmc and polytensor packages published on PyPi with documentation in sphinx.
Packages support several collaborative team projects involving Markov Chain Monte Carlo and polynomial computations leading to a 60x speed-up.

head: nanomcmc
CUDA-Accelerated Markov Chain Computation
Purdue University
body: Identified a need and led development of a GPU-accelerated computational PyTorch package for supporting several internal projects that require Markov Chain Monte Carlo, leading to a 6000% speed-up over CPU-based algorithms.

head: Polytensor
CUDA-Accelerated Polynomial Computation
Purdue University
body: Led the development, testing, and research integration of a GPU-accelerated Polynomial computation PyTorch package to support polynomial computation for three energy model projects.
Developed and tested a CUDA-accelerated polynomial computation backend, and documentation in sphinx.

head: Pauli
Pauli Algebra Interpreter and CLI Tool
Purdue University
body: Wrote a Python package for interpreting, parsing and simplifying Pauli algebra expressions using a CLI interpreter and Linux piping, allowing for the use of Pauli algebra in shell scripts.
Developed and tested a tokenizer, recursive descent parser, symbolic Pauli algebra backend, and documentation in sphinx.
